title: 106_s542
content: The "New Millennium Classrooms Act" allows for an expansion of the deduction for computer donations to schools. The New Millennium Classrooms Act extends the age limit for eligible computers and allows reacquired computers to be donated for educational purposes. The amendments made by this section apply to contributions made in taxable years after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 45D provides a credit for computer donations to schools under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The school computer donation credit under section 38 allows taxpayers to receive a credit equal to 30 percent of qualified educational contributions. This percentage increases to 50 percent for contributions made to schools in empowerment zones, enterprise communities, or Indian reservations. Certain rules from section 41(f) also apply to this credit. The school computer donation credit under section 38 allows taxpayers to receive a credit equal to 30 percent of qualified educational contributions. This percentage increases to 50 percent for contributions made to schools in empowerment zones, enterprise communities, or Indian reservations. Rules similar to section 41(f) apply. The credit terminates for taxable years starting three years after the enactment of the New Millennium Classrooms Act. Amendments are made to the Internal Revenue Code regarding the calculation of the business credit and the disallowance of deductions by the amount of the credit. The school computer donation credit under section 38 allows taxpayers to receive a credit for qualified educational contributions. The credit is limited for corporations in controlled groups or under common control. Amendments are made to the Internal Revenue Code regarding the carryback limitation of unused credits. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to limit the carryback of unused business credits, specifically the school computer donation credit under section 38. No amount of unused business credit can be carried back to a taxable year before the effective date of the amendment. The amendments to the Internal Revenue Code limit the carryback of unused business credits, including the school computer donation credit under section 38. Contributions made after the enactment of this Act will be eligible for the credit.
